content:
the Observer is a studentrun daily print  online newspaper serving Notre Dame Saint Marys  Holy Cross PERIOD Learn about us PERIOD

Charlie Ortega Guifarro  Thursday September  

Irish junior Anna Rohrer will be out for the season associate head coach Matt Sparks told The Observer on Tuesday PERIOD

Anna Rohrer had a medical procedure to stimulate the repair of her hamstring and it requires her to sit out for a couple of weeks of training Sparks said PERIOD That decision has been made that she wont be competing this year. the Mishawaka nativehas not raced yet this season but Sparks said that the coaching staff wants to make sure that Rohrer gets back to full health as opposed to risking the stars future PERIOD

Rather than have her at less than  percent were going to let her heal up fully Sparks said PERIOD Shell be ready to run track in January. the uncertainty of whether Rohrer was going to compete or not led to a drop in rankings for the womens cross country team who dropped to No PERIOD  nationallyafter being No PERIOD  to start the season PERIOD Sparks remarkedthat losing someone of Rohrers caliber is going to weaken the teams overall strength PERIOD

The drop in rankings is more of a reflection of the uncertainty of our AllAmerican Anna Rohrer who hasnt raced yet this year PERIOD Shes going to redshirt cross country this fall Sparks said PERIOD The ranking position will take a hit as far as the team goes whenever you lose your star frontrunner. rohrer was named the ACC Cross Country Freshman of the Year and finished second at the ACC cross country championships PERIOD She also finished in sixth place in the 6K at the NCAA championships in  PERIOD She was named an AllAmerican after her freshman campaign as well as making the AllACC team PERIOD

Rohrer followed up a freshman season that turned many heads with a successful sophomore year finishing third at the NCAA championships behind teammate Molly Seidel PERIOD She was named the  ACC Performer of the Year and made the AllACC Academic team PERIOD Rohrer also competes for the Irish in both the indoor and outdoor track seasons PERIOD
